Systems IncSymbiotic Group Inc.T.I.7 Inc. in Joint Venture with Tiree Consulting Inc.Valcom Consulting group Inc.Description of Work:Within the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development, the Corporate Planning, Finance and Information Technology Branch (SCM), is responsible for providing enabling services to the department, including Financial Planning and Management, Financial Operations, Grants and Contributions Management for International Development Peace and Security Programming, Information Management and Technology, Domestic Accommodations and Real Property, as well as Corporate Planning, Performance and Risk Management.As such, SCM plays a key role in ensuring the effectiveness of the financial and grants and contributions management, especially with regards to International Development, Peace and Security Programming, reporting on the international assistance spend, measuring performance on key programs, ensuring that Canada is achieving the desired outcomes through its grants and contributions programs, and providing the enabling technologies and services to achieve the above objectives.Within the above context, SCM is looking to leverage leading practices and technologies, such as analytics and robotics and international automation to enable sound financial management and reporting. In order to meet SCM’s needs, the professional services of Business Consultants are required to perform various solutions-based tasks to support SCM program delivery and to assist in the planning, preparation, execution, and management in order to facilitate achieving service strategy goals, ensuring the following is achieved/provided.Incumbent Information:Supplier: Deloitte IncContract Duration: March 8th, 2021 to presentValue: $3,300,000.00.Security Requirement: Common PS SRCL #19 appliesMinimum Corporate Security Required: SECRETMinimum Resource Security Required:  SECRETContract AuthorityName: Deeptee SeebunPhone Number: 613-791-7571Email Address: Deeptee.Seebun@international.gc.caInquiriesInquiries regarding this RFP requirement must be submitted to the Contracting Authority named above. Request for Proposal (RFP) documents will be e-mailed directly from the Contracting Authority to the Qualified Supply Arrangement Holders who are being invited to bid on this requirement. BIDDERS ARE ADVISED THAT “BUYANDSELL.GC.CA” IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DISTRIBUTION OF SOLICITATION DOCUMENTS. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language.NOTE: Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) Method of Supply is refreshed three (3) times per year. If you wish to find out how you can be a “Qualified SA Holder”, please contact RCNMDAI.-NCRIMOS@pwgsc.gc.ca
